reviews.review_msg: Jarkko is a fabulous lecturer with a profound grasp on his field and plenty of personal experiences to share with the class and use as examples, which make for really interesting lectures. He cares about his students and their success in his class, his lectures are straightforward, and he is very easy to reach outside of class.

Jarko has by far the most interesting life story that translated perfectly into what was being discussed in class. Such a caring, polite person who clearly values his work and the students he teaches. Jarko has a brilliant way of explaining concepts and incorporating class comments into his lecture. I would recommend Jarko to anyone who asks.

A very entertaining professor to have. It was exciting going to his class, as he didn't teach verbatim from the textbook. His midterm was difficult as it felt really random what was on it, but we were very well prepared for the final. Only thing I didn't like was watching videos all class occasionally because I came from out of town for his classes
Jarko makes me want to never leave college, he's the best professor in the world.

Very interesting lectures. Likes students to think and debate and discuss, and encourages and is respectful of opinions. Helpful in assignments, and gives a lot of examples, so you actually usually do understand what he's teaching. Makes a lot of jokes and is cheerful, and doesn't use confusing terms.  A really good prof.
Messy writing, talks too fast, textbook is absolute crap - too detailed, confusing, unnecessary fancy writing.
Jarkko is one of my favorite profs. He is intelligent, open-minded yet very humble. He has amazing public speaking skills, with short & sweet intriguing tangents.

hands down, prof JJ is one of the best profs i've ever had in my 7 semesters here at sfu. i hate taking history courses but psyc207 turned out to be fun, enjoyable, and totally worthwhile -- and i took it during intersession! he's funny, he's smart, he's spontaneous, he's a great teacher. period. oh, and he's totally a fox too. ;-) (is he retired?)
Interesting Class~ Nice Prof.

Jarkko is awesome!! i didn't expect i will enjoy this class but it turns out that it was one of the best class i've every had. He is definitely knowlegeable and fun. The text was hard but i managed to get a B without reading the text but focused on his and the ta's notes.

Amazing professor; one of the best I've ever had.  He's so passionate about his work that it inspires myself and others.  He took a boring class and made it one of my favourites.  You won't miss a class because his lectures are so interesting.  The text book sucks, but if you take notes and go to tutorials you'll do well.

The midterm was difficult but the final exam was a breeze. Attend all lectures-tutorial seemed to be a waste of time. The textbook was awful so make use of TA notes. However, sometimes the notes the TA supplied weren't that helpful. This was one of my least favourite Psychology courses that I have taken.

I was surprized by how interesting this class was!!! I thought it would be boring but it's not.  Great lectures and tutorials!!! Don't bother with the text.  Make GOOD notes, study from those and don't miss a lecture.
Makes the class fun with his jokes, and he explains things very well.
Organization could use some work, but he is obviously brilliant. I'd like to see him fight with Mark Blair. Perferably it a battle of wits. Tests and assignments were fair.
take this course with him. my advice is to not read the text and ONLY read the lecture notes and what he talks about in class.
one of the best psyc classes at sfu in regards to the prof, tutorials, and textbook. jalva really cares about what he is teaching which is refreshing.
He explains everything very logically and clearly.  He made the course material interesting with his wit and examples.
Very clear & friendly. Seems to know what he's talking about & is a fiar grader
Best prof ever! very clear and always repeating himself to ensure everybody's got it. exams are not hard as long as you go to class & study the notes and the practice questions in tutorials!

I just took the intersession course with him. difficult textbook, but great lectures (very helpful & somewhat clear); the pace was very fast, especially after the midterm. He's a nice guy, and it's great to have him for psyc 207. :)

He is adorable, he definitely loves teaching. He is always there for help. Test materials are base on MC short ans and Essay..not hard at all if you understand all the materials.  Interssession class weren't hard at all. He repeat himself often so students can remember it for exams. He is a great professor. Waiting for him to teach 307 next summer

Obviously loves what he teaches.  Exams are pretty simple.  Take good notes and study them because that's the majority of the tests.  He's funny and makes what could be a really horrible class into something that's tolerable.

He's a very good teacher, clear, and eager to help.  Ive never had a class go so slow because he wants everyone to understand what he's talking about.  That being said however the book is, in a word, painful.

Don't get scared when you see him - he may seem intimidating and boring, but in reality, he makes a boring historical material sound interesting - I didn't miss any lecture - and you can't really cuz he doesnt post anything online. Prepare to listen(text is full of useless bs and won't help you much

He has a good sense of humour but not a very good lecturer. You can pretty much completely ignore the textbook for this class. Can be a bit boring sometimes. He likes to concentrate on the stories instead of the facts, which can make it interesting and easier to remember. Decent prof.

He is a sweetheart - very helpful. He is not the clearest of lecturers, though he tries. He repeats himself a lot, trying to be helpful, but he just ends up cycling through the same information again and again. He really is a darling though; I bet he would be fantastic as a seminar instructor.
MMM. He's great. Charming indeed.

I have only heard him read one(first)lecture and was shocked by how boring it was. He said so much bs and nonsense that my ears started to hurt. I could not wait until the end and left earlier. But the comments on this site make me want to attend another lecture just to make sure.(BenStiller+monkey)
No Comments

I HATE History classes and he made his class one of my favorites @ SFU. He is just a great teacher with an awesome sense of humour. People say he is hard but if you pay attention in class and follow his lecture notes you'll do awesome!!
Great sense of humour. He obviously enjoys teaching and makes the otherwise dry material relevent and interesting. I wish he was teaching more than one course

Pretty straight forward class. Go to lectures, take good notes & read the boring text, and you'll do fine on the tests. Tutorials are a waste of time, but have to go to get participation marks. Overall, not a bad class, Jarko makes it enjoyable due to his humor and teaching style; He's a good prof.
he is a very clear and charming TEACHER. I can tell that he takes teaching seriously. Very humerous as well. He made this class interesting.
Overall, he is an easy prof.  If you study his notes well and read the text, you will get a good grade.
Really cares about the students. Very helpful and understanding. Made the course as interesting as was possible.
good course...a lot of work
Loved the course!! His teaching style is clear, and concise, and he is entertaining to say the least. Exams are fair, and marked well.
He is not clear and he does not make the class very interesting.
Great guy and makes class funny... but he is not very clear in presenting the information and he gives hardly any notes to study from.
boring class, but he tries his best.
One of the best PSYC prof ;) and a great guy too!
he makes everything clear...the text really sucks
Funny.
Exams are easy, no tricky questions, essay gave you ahead of time.  Lectures are interesting.  And he is a nice guy.
No Comments
Could provide more notes during lecture
not very clear
He is hilarious, if you have the chance to take a course with him do it.
He's funny and interesting and makes a boring subject fun. He's nice to look at as well :)
No Comments
very interesting, witty and adds life to all aspects of the course
isn't very clear but is interesting... sometimes... horrible class nonetheless
fascinating + enlightening lectures! funny too ;)
adds his own spin... makes a really icky subject a little less icky
